primary.description: Preferred for fluent and columns of body text. Examples: Body, block text, and long-form text.

secondary.description: Can be used for columns of body text. Examples: Body and block text.

tertiary.description: Can be used for content text that is intended to be read but is not body, column or block text. Examples: Titles, kickers, and short snippets.

quartenary.description: Can be used for any non-content text considered as “spot readable”. Examples: Placeholder text, disabled element text, copyright text, mostly-solid icons.

quinary.description: Can be used for any non-text elements that need to be discernible and differentiable. Examples: Dividers, large buttons, thick focus outlines.

senary.description: Can be used for any non-text elements that need to be barely differentiable. Examples: Dividers, backgrounds.

septenary.description: Can be used for any non-text elements that need to be barely differentiable. Examples: Dividers, backgrounds.

contained-hover-background.description: Background color of filled object in hovered state.

contained-pressed-background.description: Background color of filled object in pressed state.

primary.description: Preferred for fluent and columns of body text. Examples: Body, block text, and long-form text.

secondary.description: Can be used for content text that is intended to be read but is not body, column or block text. Examples: Titles, kickers, and short snippets.

tertiary.description: Can be used for any non-content text considered as “spot readable”. Examples: Placeholder text, disabled element text, copyright text, mostly-solid icons.

quartenary.description: Can be used for any non-text elements that need to be discernible and differentiable. Examples: Dividers, large buttons, thick focus outlines.

quinary.description: Can be used for any non-text elements that need to be barely differentiable. Examples: Dividers, backgrounds.

senary.description: Can be used for any non-text elements that need to be barely differentiable. Examples: Dividers, backgrounds.

septenary.description: Can be used for any non-text elements that need to be barely differentiable. Examples: Dividers, backgrounds.

contained-hover-background.description: Background color of filled object in hovered state.

contained-pressed-background.description: Background color of filled object in pressed state.

primary.description: Preferred for fluent and columns of body text. Examples: Body, block text, and long-form text.

secondary.description: Can be used for columns of body text. Examples: Body and block text.

disabled.description: Text color for disabled, unavailable or blocked states.

lighter.description: Can be used for any non-text elements that need to be discernible and differentiable. Examples: notification background, background of large icons.

highlight.description: Used to change the tone of certain texts on inverse background. Can be used for any non-text elements on default background. Examples: highlighted header text, part of an illustration.

light.description: Can be used for any non-text elements that need to be discernible and differentiable. Examples: Backgrounds, large icons, illustrations.

main.description: Used as background color for most interactive elements. Can be used for branded backgrounds, icons and text.

dark.description: Can be used for fluend and columns of body text, or as complementary background color. Examples: emphasised body text, background of illustration.

contrast.description: Used for content sitting on top of the main color.

contained-hover-background.description: Background color of filled object in hovered state.

contained-pressed-background.description: Background color of filled object in pressed state.

outlined-resting-border.description: Border color of interactive component in this color.

outlined-hover-background.description: Background color of outlined object in hovered state.

outlined-pressed-background.description: Background color of outlined object in pressed state.

outlined-pressed-background.description: Background color of outlined object in pressed state.

background.description: Used for background of informational notification.

content.description: Used for text, icons and imagery in info notification.

default.description: Used as global background color of the entire app.

paper.description: Used as global background color of elements with higher vertical index.

alt.description: Can be used as background color of particulcar screen or section.

one.description: Can only be used on content that requires user to input their choice. Examples: color picker.

two.description: Can only be used on content that requires user to input their choice. Examples: color picker.

three.description: Can only be used on content that requires user to input their choice. Examples: color picker.

four.description: Can only be used on content that requires user to input their choice. Examples: color picker.

five.description: Can only be used on content that requires user to input their choice. Examples: color picker.

six.description: Can only be used on content that requires user to input their choice. Examples: color picker.

seven.description: Can only be used on content that requires user to input their choice. Examples: color picker.

eight.description: Can only be used on content that requires user to input their choice. Examples: color picker.

active.description: Can only be applied to certain flat interactive elements. Examples: icon button.

hover.description: Can only be applied to certain flat interactive elements in hovered state. Examples: icon button.

selected.description: Can only be applied as background color to an element in selection. Examples: selected items in a vertical list.

disabled-background.description: Can only be applied as background color of a disabled, interactive element. Examples: text button.

disabled.description: Can only be applied as content color of a disabled, interactive element. Examples: text in a disabled button.

divider.description: Can only be applied on dividers and other borders separating parts of the content.

outlined-border.description: Can only be applied as border color to certain elements. Examples: Border of a card or accordion section.

standard-input-line.description: Can only be applied to underlined input border in resting state.

filled-input-background.description: Can only be applied as background color to filled input in resting state.

backdrop-overlay.description: Can only be applied to background overlays visible behind a modal or dialog.

rating-active.description: Can only be applied to a rating component in Material UI.

snackbar-background.description: Can only be applied as background color to Snackbar component.

action-focused.description: Can only be applied as border of a focused interactive or non-interactive element.
